code.displayName: Chief Complaint and Reason for Visit

section.title: Chief Complaint and Reason for Visit

tr.td:
Anemia in chronic kidney disease
Anemia of renal disease

section.title: Assessments
section.text:
The Patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated
Ms Rebecca for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Rebecca recovered
from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever
greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact
emergency.

tr.td:
a. Need to gain more energy to do regular activities.
b Negotiated Goals to keep Body temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring.

section.title: Plan of Treatment
section.text:
Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for follow up with Outpatient facility for
Immunosuppressive Therapy

section.title: Hospital Discharge Instructions
section.text:
a. Diet: Diabetic low salt diet
b. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised.
c. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week. Follow up with Outpatient
facility for Immunosuppression treatment.
d. For Fever of > 101.5 F, or onset of chest pain/breathlessness contact Emergency.
